name: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms with Mashed Cannellini Beans and Harissa Sauce
author: Tanya Demeris
summary: This appetizer is loaded with so many flavors and it's vegetarian and healthy. Give it a shot if you want to impress! It may sound like a ton of work, but it really is simple. If you like bold flavors, you will love it!
ingredients: 1  roasted red pepper, peeled and minced
directions: Mix roasted red pepper, shallot, garlic, 1 teaspoon olive oil, mint, lime juice, Dijon mustard, cilantro, 1/2 teaspoon salt, red pepper flakes, coriander, 1 pinch black pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl to make harissa sauce
Combine cannellini beans and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat; heat until warmed through, about 5 minutes
Combine drained beans, 2 teaspoons truffle oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a food processor; puree until smooth
Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
Brush mushroom caps on both sides with 4 teaspoons olive oil; season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper
Grill mushrooms, gill-side up, basting frequently with vegetable broth, about 4 minutes per side
Top each mushroom cap with 1/2 cup bean puree and 2 tablespoons of harissa sauce
